column2: CALIFORNIA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Which of these vehicles must stop before crossing railroad tracks?
column4: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.
column6: Motorhomes or pickup trucks towing a trailer.
column8: Sport utility vehicles carrying four or more persons.

column2: 2. When driving in the far right lane of a freeway, you:
column4: must give the right-of-way to merging traffic.
column6: should expect merging vehicles at on-ramps.
column8: must be driving slower than other traffic.

column2: 3. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: suggested speed
column6: maximum speed

column2: 4. A school bus with flashing red lights is on the other side of a divided highway. You:
column4: must slow down and prepare to stop.
column6: do not need to stop.
column8: must stop and remain stopped until the lights stop flashing.

column2: 5. You are going to make a left turn from a dedicated left-turn lane when a yellow arrow appears for your lane. You should:
column4: be prepared to obey the next signal that appears.
column6: stop and not turn under any circumstances.
column8: speed up to get through the intersection.

column2: 6. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column4: The driver on the right.
column6: The driver on the left.

column2: 7. Before crossing any railroad tracks, you must:
column4: make sure there is room for your vehicle on the other side.
column6: look and listen for trains.

column2: 8. This sign indicates:
column4: Phone service ahead
column6: Emergency line available

column2: 9. Drivers are required to obey instructions from:
column4: Other drivers whose vehicles are broken down on the roadway.
column6: Security guards patrolling parking lots.

column2: 10. For which of the following traffic lights must you always stop your vehicle?
column4: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and yellow lights.
column6: Solid red lights, flashing red lights, and blacked-out traffic signals.
column8: Solid red lights, red arrows, and flashing yellow lights.

column2: 11. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: Drive with caution.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 12. When sharing the road with a light rail vehicle, you:
column4: may turn in front of an approaching light rail vehicle at an uncontrolled intersection.
column6: may not drive in the lane next to the light rail vehicle.
column8: should monitor all traffic signals closely because light rail vehicles can interrupt traffic signals.

column2: 13. Smoking inside a vehicle when a person younger than 18 years of age is present is:
column4: up to the driver to decide.
column6: legal, if it is your child.

column2: 14. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 15. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: in both directions may pass.
column8: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 16. Allow extra space in front of your vehicle when following a:
column4: station wagon.
column6: motorcycle.

column2: 17. Which of the following is true about use of your turn signals?
column4: If you signal for a lane change, other drivers must let you in.
column6: You must always signal for lane changes.
column8: You should never use both electric and hand signals.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on green arrow only.
column6: Right turn only lane.

column2: 19. Which of the following is true about vehicles displaying a diamond shaped sign indicating hazardous load?
column4: They are not allowed to exceed 35 MPH.
column6: They are not allowed to drive on freeways.
column8: They must stop before crossing railroad tracks.

column2: 20. If you have a collision, you are required by law to exchange your driver license information with:
column4: security guards.
column6: others involved in the collision.

column2: 21. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Never depend on
column6: Never use

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 23. A police officer is signaling you to continue driving through a red light. What should you do?
column4: Come to a complete stop, then do what the officer tells you.
column6: Do as the officer tells you.

column2: 24. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 25. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Police officer
column6: Red light

column2: 26. Which shape is a stop sign?
column4: Octagon
column6: Upside-down triangle

column2: 27. While waiting to turn left, you should keep your wheels pointed straight ahead until it is safe to turn. Why?
column4: If your wheels are pointed to the left, and a vehicle hits you from behind, you could be pushed into oncoming traffic.
column6: If you change your mind, the wheels will be already pointing in the right direction.
column8: It is easier to deactivate your anti-lock system.

column2: 28. When you are merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:
column4: The posted speed limit for traffic on the freeway.
column6: 5 to 10 MPH slower than the traffic on the freeway.
column8: At or near the same speed as the traffic on the freeway.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Pedestrian sidewalk ahead.
column6: Pedestrians must yield the right-of-way ahead.

column2: 30. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have overslept.
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 31. Drivers must obey instructions from school crossing guards:
column4: during school hours only.
column6: only in front of a school.

column2: 32. When should you yield your legal right-of way?
column4: often, even at controlled intersections.
column6: when it helps prevent collisions.

column2: 33. During darkness, bicyclists must have:
column4: a front lamp emitting a yellow light visible from a distance of 100 feet.
column6: a rear red reflector visible from a distance of 500 feet.
column8: a white reflector on the bicyclistâ€™s helmet.

column2: 34. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.
column6: obey signals from crossing guards.

column2: 35. When driving near road work zones, you should:
column4: pass the work zone carefully and avoid distractions.
column6: slow down to watch the work as you pass.

column2: 36. This red and white sign means:
column4: the road ahead is closed to traffic in your direction.
column6: do not enter the road ahead unless it is safe to do so.
column8: the road ahead is closed to traffic in all directions.
